shortdesc.ph: Determines whether to receive video data from multiple channels.
Determines whether to receive video data from multiple channels.

section.p: After you register the video frame observer, the SDK triggers this callback every time it captures a video frame. After you register the video frame observer, the SDK triggers this callback every time it captures a video frame.

In the multi-channel scenario, if you want to get video data from multiple channels, set the return value of this callback as true. In the multi-channel scenario, if you want to get video data from multiple channels, set the return value of this callback as true. After successful setting, the SDK will trigger a callback to send you the received remote video frame and report which channel the video frame comes from. After successful setting, the SDK will trigger a callback to send you the received remote video frame and report which channel the video frame comes from.

ul.li: Once you set the return value of this callback as true, the SDK triggers only the `onRenderVideoFrameEx` callback to send the video frame. Once you set the return value of this callback as true, the SDK triggers only the `onRenderVideoFrameEx` callback to send the video frame. Will not be triggered. Will not be triggered. In the multi-channel scenario, Agora recommends setting the return value as true. In the multi-channel scenario, Agora recommends setting the return value as true.

If you set the return value of this callback as false, the SDK triggers only the `onRenderVideoFrame` callback to send the video data. If you set the return value of this callback as false, the SDK triggers only the `onRenderVideoFrame` callback to send the video data.
`true`: Receive audio data from multiple channels. `true`: Receive audio data from multiple channels.
`false`: Do not receive audio data from multiple channels. `false`: Do not receive audio data from multiple channels.
